contentrichtext.text: {{Onesource|date=March 2009}} {{Infobox Company | company_name = XOrbit, Inc.| | company_logo = [[Image:XOrbit.png]]| | company_type = [[Private Company|Private]]| | foundation = April 10, 1996 | | location = [[Columbia, MD]], [[United States|USA]]|| | key_people = [[Steven Blumenschein]] Founder/President| | industry = [[Captioning|Closed captioning]]<br>[[Delivery Verification]]| | homepage = http://www.xorbit.com| }} '''XOrbit''', Inc., a privately held organization, claims to strive toward improving the quality of closed caption technologies for the hearing impaired, a U.S. [[Federal Communications Commission]] (FCC) requirement for broadcasters.<ref>http://www.xorbit.com</ref> XOrbit develops and promotes products that purportedly eases the improvement and quality of closed captioning services for broadcast and cable television channels at a lower cost than traditional techniques.<ref>http://www.xorbit.com/xo08_dl.aspx?ID=40</ref> For example, they provide a product that prevents broadcasters from having to re-encode line21 captioning information into media whenever a change to the captioning is made.<ref>http://www.xorbit.com/xo08_products.aspx?1=divProductUltraCast</ref> They also provide a product that allows stenographers to send captioning for a live event without requiring a satellite feed for the audio/video content (using TCP/IP technologies).<ref>http://www.xorbit.com/xo08_products.aspx?1=divProductRTX</ref> In 2003, [[Turner Entertainment]] gained a [[Technology & Engineering Emmy Award]] for XOrbit's closed caption server technology. In 2009, XOrbit was awarded a [[National Academy of Television Arts and Sciences]] [[Technology & Engineering Emmy Award]] for Real-Time Delivery Confirmation Systems, a service to ensure that content (such as television commercials contracted by a network, or regular network programming) reaches the end viewer as transmitted.<ref>http://www.tvmainstream.com/default.cfm?ID=10515&type=wmhigh&clip=2</ref> ==External links== * [http://www.xorbit.com/ Official Website of XOrbit, Inc.] * [http://www.fcc.gov/cgb/dro/captioning_regs.html/ FCC Report and Order for Closed Captioning] ==References== <references/> [[Category:Companies established in 1996]] [[Category:Privately held companies based in Maryland]] [[Category:Companies based in Columbia, Maryland]]
